page.title: 01Summary of Area
page.content: Hartfield is a parish to the north of the administrative county of East Sussex. It is situated on the northern sloapes of the Ashdown Forest on the High Weald. The River Medway,which flows from west to north east has its source near by. It is only a few metres wide in our parish. Two roads pass through the village, the B2026 from Edenbridge(7 miles)to Uckfield(10 miles), from north to south.The other road being the B2110 from Tunbridge Wells (8 miles )to East Grinstead (8 miles ),east to west. The altitude of our block above sea level is from 160' to 430'. The soil is clay. The population is around 1800 spread out over a large area. Most people work in neighbouring towns and London but a few people work on the farms,public houses and schools.
